009
010package imagingbook.common.color.statistics;
011
012import java.util.Arrays;
013
014/**
015 * This class calculates a color histogram of a set of colors (i.e., a color
016 * image). Only the unique colors are accounted for. Colors are supplied as
017 * ARGB-encoded integers (A = alpha values being ignored). Colors are internally
018 * sorted by their frequency (in descending order).
019 * Used mainly for color quantization.
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 * @version 2022/11/05
023 */
024public class ColorHistogram {
025        
026        private final ColorBin[] colorBins;
027        
028        /**
029         * Creates a color histogram instance from the supplied sequence
030         * of color pixel values (assumed to be aRGB-encoded integers).
031         * The original pixel values are not modified.
032         * 
033         * @param pixels aRGB-encoded integer pixel data 
034         */
035        public ColorHistogram(int[] pixels) {
036                this(pixels, false);
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Creates a color histogram instance from the supplied sequence
041         * of color pixel values (assumed to be ARGB-encoded integers).
042         * The original pixel values are not modified.
043         * 
044         * @param pixelsOrig original pixel values (not modified)
045         * @param sortByFrequency set true to sort the final colors by descending frequency
046         */
047        public ColorHistogram(int[] pixelsOrig, boolean sortByFrequency) {
048                int[] pixels = new int[pixelsOrig.length];
049                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
050                        pixels[i] = 0xFFFFFF & pixelsOrig[i];   // remove alpha components
051                }
052                
053                Arrays.sort(pixels);    // this is why we need a copy of the input array
054                
055                // count unique colors:
056                int k = -1; // current color index
057                int curColor = -1;
058                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
059                        if (pixels[i] != curColor) {
060                                k++;
061                                curColor = pixels[i];
062                        }
063                }
064                int nUnique = k + 1;    // number of unique colors
065                
066                colorBins = new ColorBin[nUnique];
067                
068                // tabulate and find frequency of unique colors:
069                k = -1; // current color index
070                curColor = -1;
071                for (int i = 0; i < pixels.length; i++) {
072                        if (pixels[i] != curColor) {    // found a new color
073                                k++;
074                                curColor = pixels[i];
075                                colorBins[k] = new ColorBin(curColor);
076                        }
077                        else {                                                  // still with the previous color
078                                colorBins[k].add(1);
079                        }
080                }
081                
082                if (sortByFrequency)
083                        Arrays.sort(colorBins); // sort unique colors by descending frequency
084        }
085        
086        /**
087         * Returns the number of unique colors.
088         * @return The number of unique colors.
089         */
090        public int getNumberOfColors() {
091                return colorBins.length;
092        }
093        
094        /**
095         * Returns an array with all (distinct) colors of this histogram as sRGB
096         * int-encoded values. Values are in no particular order but in the same order
097         * as the array returned by {@link #getFrequencies()}.
098         * 
099         * @return an array of all distinct colors
100         */
101        public int[] getColors() {
102                int[] colors = new int[colorBins.length];
103                for (int i = 0; i < colorBins.length; i++) {
104                        colors[i] = colorBins[i].rgb;
105                }
106                return colors;
107        }
108        
109        /**
110         * Returns an array with the frequencies of all (distinct) colors of this
111         * histogram. Values are in no particular order but in the same order as the
112         * array returned by {@link #getColors()}.
113         * 
114         * @return an array of all distinct color frequencies
115         */
116        public int[] getFrequencies() {
117                int[] frequencies = new int[colorBins.length];
118                for (int i = 0; i < colorBins.length; i++) {
119                        frequencies[i] = colorBins[i].count;
120                }
121                return frequencies;
122        }
123        
124        /**
125         * Returns the unique color with the given index.
126         * Colors are sorted by (decreasing) frequency.
127         * 
128         * @param index The color index.
129         * @return      The color, encoded as an ARGB integer (A is zero).
130         */
131        public int getColor(int index) {
132                return colorBins[index].rgb;
133        }
134        
135        /**
136         * Returns the frequency of the unique color with the given index.
137         * Colors are sorted by (decreasing) frequency.
138         * @param index The color index.
139         * @return      The frequency of the color.
140         */
141        public int getFrequency(int index) {
142                return colorBins[index].count;
143        }
144        
145        /**
146         * Lists the unique colors to System.out (intended for
147         * debugging only).
148         */
149        public void listUniqueColors() {
150                for (ColorBin cn : colorBins) {
151                        System.out.println(cn.toString());
152                }
153        }
154        
155        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
156        
157        /**
158         * Represents a set of pixels with the same color.
159         */
160        private static class ColorBin implements Comparable<ColorBin> {
161                private final int rgb;  // the pixel color (aRGB-encoded int)
162                private int count;              // the size of the set
163
164                private ColorBin(int rgb) {
165                        this.rgb = rgb;
166                        this.count = 1;
167                }
168
169                /**
170                 * Add n pixels to this bin.
171                 * @param n the number of pixels to add
172                 */
173                private void add(int n) {
174                        count = count + n;      
175                }
176                
177                @Override
178                public String toString() {
179                        return String.format(ColorBin.class.getSimpleName() + " rgb=%d count=%d", rgb, count);
180                }
181
182                @Override
183                public int compareTo(ColorBin other) {  // to sort by count (high counts first)
184                        return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
185                }
186
187        }
188
189}
